org.eclipse.scada.vi.ui.draw2d.primitives

Class FigureController

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.scada.vi.ui.draw2d.primitives.FigureController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Controller
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ChartController, FigureContainerController, ImageController, ShapeController, TextController

    public abstract class FigureController
extends java.lang.Object
implements Controller
    A figure controller

    This figure controller needs to know when the figure it controls was added or removed. Since draw2d does not provide a "addRemovedListener" for IFigure but a IFigure#removeNotify() that can be overridden it is the responsibility of the implementing controller to call start() and stop() when the implementing IFigure#addNotify() and IFigure#removeNotify() get called. So create your figure like the following snippet shows: 

    IFigure figure = new PolylineShape () {
    public void addNotify () {
        super.addNotify ();
        start (); // FigureController.start ();
    }

    public void removeNotify () {
        stop (); // FigureController.stop ();
        super.removeNotify ();
    }
};

      • getPropertyFigure

        protected abstract IFigure getPropertyFigure()
        Get the figure that is used for controlling the properties of this controller.

        The figure returned is by default the same as the getFigure(). But in some cases it might be necessary to return a different figure.

        Returns:
        the figure that should the attributes applied
